comment: Good professor, responsive to questions , mostly on discussion posts. It's not a hard class, just tedious  lots of discussion posts and a big project.fair grader
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: This is the worst professor I encountered in KSU. This class was stressful. Initially, the class was assigned to different professor from who, she took all of her assignment. She did not provide clear instructions. I was on the edge with her the whole semester. My advice is please consider different professor. Also,she barely respond to emails.

This is the worst professor I have had. For being an information systems course the class was set up very unorganized. All discussion posts were due on Wednesdays and there were multiple occasions where they weren't posted until Wednesday afternoon. His main form of communication is through public discussion post...
Lots of home work and assignments but always cares about the students and ready to help. Lots of discussion posts in the course and a big project.

Took this class online orginally I had a different professor and ksu swapped them. The professor isn't a bad person but they aren't a good teacher everything is all over the place and I wish I never took this class to begin with an just withdraw when I had the chance terrible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: If you want a professor that takes weeks to respond, does not know how to use D2L, and posts assignments late consistently but keeps the same due date then take this one.
She is a good professor , responds back soon , fair grading. Lot of discussion posts. Too much homework
lectures are boring but the class discussions are very helpful. lot of work. Always willing to help. Replies  to email fast. Fair grader.

Always ready to help students. Even though attendance is required, lectures are engaing and has good questions answers. Understands students, and is willing to accept late assignments. Would reccomend!

This is one of the worst professors at KSU. Heavy work load, hard to understand, unclear grading, lack of communication, and does not care about her students. You can only communicate through discussion posts. No one knows there grade till the end because grade book so confusing.

very good professor. Had a great time in her class. Provides good feedback and provides lots of examples. Would take again. Does give a good amount of homework, but is always willing to help and it is not that difficult. Fair grader.

She is one of the worst professors I have ever had. It is clear English is not her first language, although this is not the main issue. She is rude in class, horrible at explaining concepts, asks some of the worst and least helpful "questions," and overall seems to have no idea what she is teaching or how the class is supposed to be structured.

Literally the worst professor I've ever had. I had no idea what she was saying, she can't make it clear when anything is due, takes attendance, gives the worst lectures ever, and generally the worst. I dropped the class cause I had no idea what we were doing.

She is the worst teacher I have ever had in my life. Going to class is basically pointless as you leave more confused than going in, but she takes attendance. What you have to do and when it's due is basically unknown. Very unorganized class. She has no idea what she is doing. Lots of work with no instruction, help, or teaching. Don't take her!
Thick accent, reads from powerpoints. I have no idea what she's saying. Shows up late a lot. Class is depressing and boring cause I have no idea what she's saying and it's awkward to be in that room.

Just awful in every facet imaginable. Thick accent, disorganized, reads from powerpoints, no one knows what is graded and what is not. Way too much work, and no idea when the work is due.Did not even show up to class the first day. Emailed us after the class hours saying there was no class. Mandatory attendance that isnt part of the grade?
